com.markussecundus.forms.elements

Interface Drawable<Rend,Pos>

  • Type Parameters:
    Rend - The renderer type that performs the drawing of the element to the screen or anywhere else
    Pos - Vector type used to define the position and dimensions of the element
    All Superinterfaces:
    Element
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    UberDrawable<Rend,Pos>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BasicAbstractDrawable, BasicAbstractLayout, BasicLinearLayout, DummyDrawable, ImageIcon, ImageIcon.Plain, PrimitivePositionalLayout, Slider, Slider.Basic

    public interface Drawable<Rend,Pos>
extends Element
    Basic interface for any Element, that can be drawn on the screen.
    Author:
    MarkusSecundus
    See Also:
    BasicAbstractDrawable

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Property<Pos> _sizeConstraint()
      The size constraint that can be applied by the owner of the Drawable.
      default void dispose()
      Destroys the resources owned by the Drawable, that need to be destroyed manually.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.markussecundus.forms.elements.Element

        update

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        void draw(Rend renderer,
          Pos position)
        Called each frame, renders the Drawable on the screen.
        Parameters:
        renderer - The instance of Rend using which the Drawable is to be rendered
        position - The position on which the Drawable is supposed to be drawn. By convention should define the leftmost-downmost edge of the rectangle circumscribed to the this if in 2D space

      • size

        ReadonlyProperty<Pos> size()
        The real size of the Drawable, which it takes when rendered on the screen. Supposedly should be derived from the values of other present size parameters, therefore it cannot be modified directly.
        See Also:
        DefaultSizeBehavior

      • maxSize

        Property<Pos> maxSize()
        The maximum size that the Drawable can attain. Should be strongly greater than or equal to minSize

      • minSize

        Property<Pos> minSize()
        The minimum size that the Drawable can attain. Should be strongly lower than or equal to maxSize

      • prefSize

        Property<Pos> prefSize()
        The preffered size that the Drawable will have if it is within the bounds of minSize and (maxSize,_sizeConstraint).

      • _sizeConstraint

        Property<Pos> _sizeConstraint()
        The size constraint that can be applied by the owner of the Drawable. Used eg. if the element is in a layout to regulate its size without affecting the maxSize defined by the user. If null, then no constraint is to be applied. Doesen't have shortcuts implemented for .get and .set to descourage BFU from using it.
        See Also:
        UberElement, UberDrawable

      • getVectUtil

        VectUtil<Pos,?> getVectUtil()
        Gets the VectUtil for the vector type used by this.

      • getSize

        default Pos getSize()
        Shinier shortcut for calling size().get().

      • getMaxSize

        default Pos getMaxSize()
        Shinier shortcut for calling maxSize().get().

      • getMinSize

        default Pos getMinSize()
        Shinier shortcut for calling minSize().get().

      • getPrefSize

        default Pos getPrefSize()
        Shinier shortcut for calling prefSize().get().

      • setMaxSize

        default Pos setMaxSize(Pos newSize)
        Shinier shortcut for calling maxSize().set(newSize).
        Parameters:
        newSize - new value for the Property

      • setMinSize

        default Pos setMinSize(Pos newSize)
        Shinier shortcut for calling minSize().set(newSize).
        Parameters:
        newSize - new value for the Property

      • setPrefSize

        default Pos setPrefSize(Pos newSize)
        Shinier shortcut for calling prefSize().set(newSize).
        Parameters:
        newSize - new value for the Property

      • dispose

        default void dispose()
        Destroys the resources owned by the Drawable, that need to be destroyed manually. For the sake of convenience provided with blank default implementation,
